timeline.author: kashike
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,91 @@ +From 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 +From: Jake Potrebic +Date: Tue, 22 Dec 2020 13:51:06 -0800 +Subject: [PATCH] Added EntityItemDamageEvent + + +diff --git a/src/main/java/io/papermc/paper/event/entity/EntityItemDamageEvent.java b/src/main/java/io/papermc/paper/event/entity/EntityItemDamageEvent.java +new file mode 100644 +index 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000..ee4090263f14a5d0f9606e49e36e73908528b13a +--- /dev/null ++++ b/src/main/java/io/papermc/paper/event/entity/EntityItemDamageEvent.java +@@ -0,0 +1,79 @@ ++package io.papermc.paper.event.entity; ++ ++import org.bukkit.entity.Entity; ++import org.bukkit.event.Cancellable; ++import org.bukkit.event.HandlerList; ++import org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityEvent; ++import org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack; ++import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull; ++ ++/** ++ * Called when an item on or used by an entity takes durability damage as a result of being hit/used. ++ * ++ *

++ * NOTE: default vanilla behaviour dictates that armor/tools picked up by ++ * mobs do not take damage (except via Thorns). ++ *

++ */ ++public class EntityItemDamageEvent extends EntityEvent implements Cancellable {

replies.bodyText: Doesn't that sound like its fired when an entity damages an item? Which isn't really what this is.
replies.author: Machine-Maker

replies.bodyText: EntityItemDamageEvent makes it sound like I can cancel the damage to Item entities (like throwing an item into fire)
replies.author: BillyGalbreath

replies.bodyText: There already is a PlayerItemDamageEvent which is called when this stuff happens to a player.
replies.author: Machine-Maker

replies.bodyText: @BillyGalbreath's comment is why I suggested this change.
replies.author: kashike

replies.bodyText: But then the naming isn't consistent with the already existing player event?
replies.author: Machine-Maker

replies.bodyText: Names not being consistent does not worry me.
replies.author: kashike
